text: In this video, we will show you
how to build a suburban house step by step

and share some building
ideas and tips along the way.

Use the clickable sections
below to keep track

of what step you're on
during this tutorial.

Look for an area you think
is best to build your house.
Terraform the area, if needed,
to give yourself enough space to build.
Next, plan the layout of your build
by using blocks to set a foundation.

This will show you how much
space you need for your house.

For this build, we will have
the main part in the middle
and add an extension on each side.

We will be using stone
bricks for the foundation
and smooth quartz on the edges
with light gray concrete for the walls.

Make sure to leave spaces
for windows while building.
You can use smooth quartz stairs or slabs
to give the walls more definition
and make them look less flat.
The middle and left side of the house
will have two floors,
and the right side of the house
will only have one floor.
For the roof, we will use quartz stairs
and stone brick stairs.
Use light gray concrete
to cover the gaps created by the roof.
We will also add a small extension
and roof on the right side of the house.
Fill in the spaces you left for windows
using black stained-glass panes.
You can also add windows to the roofs.
For the floor inside the house,
we will use birch planks.

Make sure to add the flooring
for the second floor as well.
We will build a porch by the main entrance

using smooth quartz
blocks, slabs, and stairs
and stone brick slabs.
Then add stairs using stone brick stairs.
To the right of the build,

we'll add a garage door
using dark oak planks.

You can also add windows
to the garage door.

We will add a stone pavement
in front of the house
and a few plants and trees around.
For the back of the house,
we will add a balcony on the second floor.
Also, we will add an entrance at the back
that leads to the yard.
You can use leaves as hedges.

We'll add a barbecue grill
using bricks and smokers

and add a table outside
to finish the backyard.
As for the interior of the house,
you can add walls to create rooms.

Next, add stairs that
lead to the second floor
using stone brick stairs.
Finish the interior however you like.
I'm going for a classic suburban vibe
with muted colors and a touch of antiques
using woodblocks and colored blocks.
